trans-unit.source: Provides a common implementation of members for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListBox"></xref> and <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox"></xref> classes.
The ListControl class provides implementations of common elements for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListBox> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox> controls.

The following properties are of primary concern to users of a data-bound <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListBox> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox>: <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.DataSource%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.DisplayMember%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.SelectedValue%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.ValueMember%2A> properties.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListControl"></xref> class.
Gets a value indicating whether the list enables selection of list items.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the list enables list item selection; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.CurrencyManager"></xref> associated with this control.
The DataManager property is valid if the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.DataSource%2A> property is set.
If this is not a data-bound control, the default is `null`.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.CurrencyManager"></xref> associated with this control.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets the data source for this <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListControl"></xref>.
There are two ways to fill the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListBox> controls.
For example, you can add objects to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox> by using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox.ObjectCollection.Add%2A> method.

You can also add objects to a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox> by using the DataSource, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.DisplayMember%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.ValueMember%2A> properties to fill the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox>.
When the DataSource property is set, a user cannot modify the items collection.
If setting the DataSource property causes the data source to change, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.DataSourceChanged> event is raised.
If setting this property causes the data member to change, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.DisplayMemberChanged> event is raised.
When you set DataSource to `null`, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.DisplayMember%2A> is set to an empty string ("").

An object that implements the <xref:System.Collections.IList> or <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IListSource"></xref> interfaces, such as a <xref href="System.Data.DataSet"></xref> or an <xref:System.Array>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
The assigned value does not implement the <xref:System.Collections.IList> or <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IListSource"></xref> interfaces.
Occurs when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.DataSource*> changes.
For more information about handling events, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
To be added.
Gets or sets the property to display for this <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListControl"></xref>.
The controls that inherit from <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl> can display diverse types of objects.
If the specified property does not exist on the object or the value of DisplayMember is an empty string (""), the results of the object's `ToString` method are displayed instead.
If the new display member cannot be set, the previous display member setting is maintained.
A <xref:System.String> specifying the name of an object property that is contained in the collection specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.DataSource*> property.
The default is an empty string ("").
Occurs when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.DisplayMember*> property changes.
For more information about handling events, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
To be added.
Retrieves the current value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListControl"></xref> item, if it is a property of an object, given the item.
The object the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListControl"></xref> item is bound to.
The filtered object.
Returns the current value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListControl"></xref> item, if it is a property of an object given the item and the property name.
The object the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListControl"></xref> item is bound to.
The property name of the item the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListControl"></xref> is bound to.
The filtered object.
Occurs when the control is bound to a data value.
The Format event is raised before each visible item in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl> is formatted.

Handling this event gives you access to the string to be displayed for this list item, through the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ConvertEventArgs.Value%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControlConvertEventArgs>.
For more information about handling events, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
To be added.
Gets or sets the <xref:System.IFormatProvider> that provides custom formatting behavior.
Setting the FormatInfo property will override the default formatting behavior, which uses the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Application.CurrentCulture%2A> setting.
The <xref:System.IFormatProvider> implementation that provides custom formatting behavior.
Occurs when the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.FormatInfo*> property changes.
For more information about handling events, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
To be added.
Gets or sets the format-specifier characters that indicate how a value is to be displayed.
The format string used must follow standard [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/add/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] format specifications.
For more information, see [Formatting Types in the .NET Framework](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The string of format-specifier characters that indicates how a value is to be displayed.
Occurs when value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.FormatString*> property changes
For more information about handling events, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
To be added.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether formatting is applied to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.DisplayMember*> property of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListControl"></xref>.
Setting the FormattingEnabled property to `true` causes the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.Format> event to be raised for each visible member of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl>.

<xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox.SelectedIndex%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.SelectedValue%2A>, and FormattingEnabled are related as follows: - If FormattingEnabled is `false`, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox.SelectedIndex%2A> will not be set to -1 when <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.SelectedValue%2A> is blank.
- If FormattingEnabled is `true`, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox.SelectedIndex%2A> will be set to -1 when <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.SelectedValue%2A> is blank.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if formatting of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.DisplayMember*> property is enabled; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Occurs when the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.FormattingEnabled*> property changes.
For more information about handling events, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
To be added.
Returns the text representation of the specified item.
The object from which to get the contents to display.

If the property is not specified, the value returned by GetItemText is the value of the item's method. Otherwise, the method returns the string value of the member specified in the property for the object specified in the item parameter.
Handles special input keys, such as PAGE UP, PAGE DOWN, HOME, END, and so on.
One of the values of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Keys"></xref>.
if the keyData parameter specifies the , , , or key; if the keyData parameter specifies .
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.BindingContextChanged"></xref> event.
An <xref:System.EventArgs> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.DataSourceChanged"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The OnDataSourceChanged method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
An <xref:System.EventArgs> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.DisplayMemberChanged"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The OnDisplayMemberChanged method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
An <xref:System.EventArgs> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.Format"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The OnFormat method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListControlConvertEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.FormatInfoChanged"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The OnFormatInfoChanged method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
An <xref:System.EventArgs> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.FormatStringChanged"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The OnFormatStringChanged method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
An <xref:System.EventArgs> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.FormattingEnabledChanged"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The OnFormattingEnabledChanged method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
An <xref:System.EventArgs> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.SelectedValueChanged"></xref> event.
For more information about handling events, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
An <xref:System.EventArgs> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.SelectedValueChanged"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
An <xref:System.EventArgs> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.ValueMemberChanged"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The OnValueMemberChanged method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
An <xref:System.EventArgs> that contains the event data.
When overridden in a derived class, resynchronizes the data of the object at the specified index with the contents of the data source.
The zero-based index of the item whose data to refresh.
When overridden in a derived class, resynchronizes the item data with the contents of the data source.
When overridden in a derived class, gets or sets the zero-based index of the currently selected item.
A zero-based index of the currently selected item.
A value of negative one (-1) is returned if no item is selected.
Gets or sets the value of the member property specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.ValueMember*> property.
If a property is not specified in <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.ValueMember%2A>, SelectedValue returns the results of the `ToString` method of the object.

<xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox.SelectedIndex%2A>, SelectedValue, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.FormattingEnabled%2A> are related as follows: - If <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.FormattingEnabled%2A> is `false`, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox.SelectedIndex%2A> will not be set to -1 when SelectedValue is blank.
- If <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.FormattingEnabled%2A> is `true`, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox.SelectedIndex%2A> will be set to -1 when SelectedValue is blank.
An object containing the value of the member of the data source specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.ValueMember*> property.
The assigned value is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> or the empty string ("").
Occurs when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.SelectedValue*> property changes.
For more information about handling events, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
To be added.
When overridden in a derived class, sets the object with the specified index in the derived class.
The array index of the object.
The object.
When overridden in a derived class, sets the specified array of objects in a collection in the derived class.
An array of items.
Gets or sets the path of the property to use as the actual value for the items in the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListControl"></xref>.
Specify the contents of the ValueMember property in cases where you bind data.
You can clear the ValueMember property by setting the property to an empty string ("") or `null`.
Setting a new ValueMember property raises the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.ValueMemberChanged> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.SelectedValueChanged> events.

A <xref:System.String> representing a single property name of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.DataSource*> property value, or a hierarchy of period-delimited property names that resolves to a property name of the final data-bound object.
The default is an empty string ("").
The specified property path cannot be resolved through the object specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.DataSource*> property.
Occurs when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.ValueMember*> property changes.
For more information about handling events, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
To be added.
